intro: Isotrema hyperxanthum, commonly known as the golden thistle, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky environments. Its flowers are typically arranged in composite heads, a common feature among plants in the daisy family. Isotrema hyperxanthum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
